intro: Angiopteris cupreata, commonly known as the copper shield fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, shield-shaped fronds that are typically dark green with a copper-colored margin. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with the rhizome often covered in a layer of brown, scaly tissue. Its fronds are pinnately compound, with small, ovate leaflets arranged along the central axis. Angiopteris cupreata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
